entry.title: New release for Chartbrew: v4.0.0
entry.content:
âš ï¸ Important changes in v4

  • Node.js 22+ is now required to run Chartbrew. Please upgrade your Node.js environment before updating.
  • Chartbrew is now operating under a dual license:
  • Functional Source License (FSL) for most use cases
  • Commercial License available for businesses needing more flexibility
    Read more about the new licensing model in LICENSE.md â†’

  • Added long text popover to easily read long text cells in tables.

  • Added option to invert growth in KPI segments for customizable metrics tracking.

  • Improved guidance for first-time users without created connections.

entry.title: New release for Chartbrew: v4.1.0
entry.content:
Changelog

âœ¨ New features

  • Added full variable support across the platform:
  • Variables can now be used in dataset filters, chart editors, Firestore, RealtimeDB, MongoDB, ClickHouse, and API requests
  • Variables can be passed through chart filters, dashboard filters, and Embedded chart/report URL parameters
  • Defaults can be set when creating a variable anywhere in the UI
  • Added a data transformation feature for all data requests, allowing inline data processing before rendering
  • Added support for Customer.io activities, with better dashboard integrations

ğŸš€ Feature improvements

  • Redesigned the dataset builder steps for a more intuitive flow
  • Improved connection selection UI and added explainer icons for invalid connections
  • Improved dataset list layout to simplify cleaning and maintenance
  • Ensured connections and datasets preload properly when loading dashboards directly
  • Allowed automatic number conversion for sum/average operations on stringified numeric values
  • Restored the Create Connection button in dashboards when empty
  • Added a copy image button in the snapshot modal for easier sharing

ğŸ› Bug fixes

  • Fixed UI crash when refreshing the connection edit page
  • Fixed bug where variables would cause a crash if the growth comparison value wasnâ€™t a number
  • Fixed issues with variable bindings not syncing correctly in filters and Firestore
  • Fixed various crashes in the dataset builder
  • Fixed Customer.io activity display limits
  • Fixed state persistence issues in visual filters and when building queries with variables
  • Fixed SSH tunnel bug where the host and port were not reset after connection

entry.title: New release for Chartbrew: v4.2.0

  • Redesigned the signup screen with a cleaner layout and smaller padding.

ğŸ› Bug fixes

  • Fixed issue with anomaly detection by switching to a new hosted service.
